title-group.article-title: Hedging Volatility Shocks to the Canadian Investment Opportunity Set

abstract.p: A volatility shock model is used to assess whether Canadian investors are interested in an asset's ability to hedge volatility shocks (the asset's coskewness) and shocks to the market mean return (the asset's beta). This study indicates that the risk premiums for beta and coskewness vary over time and are sensitive to market conditions in the United States (coskewness) and Canada (beta and coskewness). The risk premium for coskewness shows a seasonal effect in January and September, while the risk premium for beta is sensitive to the month of September. The performance of the volatility shock model using U.S. data is similar to the outcomes found using Canadian data. The Canadian investor, however, is willing to pay more for an asset's potential protection capabilities.
